soc.robot

Class RobberStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.robot.RobberStrategy

  • public class RobberStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
    Discard strategy for a SOCRobotBrain in a game. For details see getBestRobberHex() and chooseRobberVictim(boolean[], boolean).

    Before version 2.2.00 these methods were static and could not easily be extended.

    • Method Detail

      • getBestRobberHex

        public int getBestRobberHex()
        Determine the best hex to move the robber, based on board and current opponent info in SOCPlayerTrackers. Calls selectPlayerToThwart(int), selectRobberHex(int, int).

        Currently the robot always chooses to move the robber, never the pirate, so this method calculates for the robber only.

        Returns:
        Hex coordinate to move robber to. Should be a member of SOCBoard.getLandHexCoords().

      • chooseRobberVictim

        public int chooseRobberVictim(boolean[] isVictim,
                              boolean canChooseNone)
        Choose a robbery victim, from players with pieces adjacent to the robber (or pirate).
        Parameters:
        isVictim - Boolean array indicating which players are possible victims; 1 element per player number (0 to game.maxPlayers - 1).
        canChooseNone - In some game scenarios (such as SC_PIRI), the robot may have the option to choose to not rob anyone. This strategy ignores that and always chooses a victim to rob.
        Returns:
        Player number to rob, or -1 if none could be decided
        See Also:
        selectPlayerToThwart(int)

      • selectPlayerToThwart

        public int selectPlayerToThwart(int robberHex)
        Select the player to target with the robber given the current hex the robber is on. Unlike chooseRobberVictim(boolean[], boolean), the robber may be moved because caller might call selectRobberHex(int, int) with the result from selectPlayerToThwart.

        Default implementation targets the player closest to winning. This may be overridden, for example, to target the player with the resources we want most.

        Parameters:
        robberHex - the current location of the robber
        Returns:
        a valid player number
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • selectRobberHex

        public int selectRobberHex(int prevRobberHex,
                           int victimNum)
        Select the hex to rob, based on the fact we are targeting the specified player, and the robber is currently on the specified hex. Used by getBestRobberHex().
        Parameters:
        prevRobberHex - the robber's current location
        victimNum - the targeted player
        Returns:
        a valid hex coordinate
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        selectPlayerToThwart(int)
